content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(col), r"\s" => "_"), r"-" => "_")
end
```

This function first lowers the case of the input column name using the `lowercase` function. Then it uses the `replace` function twice to replace any whitespace characters (`\s`) and hyphens with an underscore. The regular expression `r"\s"` matches any whitespace character, and `r"-"` matches a hyphen. The resulting string is returned as the cleaned column name.<|im_end|>
<|endoftext|>
